newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Foreigners' Taiwan share profits slide in August.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners' Taiwan share profits slide in August.

text.p: Foreign institutions investing in Taiwan's stock market posted an average profit margin of 21.17 percent in August, down from 24.39 percent in July, the Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday.
The commission, in a statement, did not say why the profit margin dropped despite the overall stock market rising over 160 points in August.
As of August 31, foreign institutions have remitted a net total of T$221.3 billion into Taiwan, of which 82.09 percent was invested in the stock market.
Foreign institutions remitted T$10.83 billion into Taiwan in August alone, the statement said.
The commission said it has approved a total of 207 foreign institutions to invest in Taiwan equities as of September 23.
